meanings.definition: To coat or treat with platinum.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler will platinize the ring to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: She decided to platinize her necklace for a special occasion.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to platinize the dessert with edible silver, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to platinize the canvas with each stroke.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to platinize the ocean, creating a dazzling effect.

meanings.sent1: The scientist was able to platinize the metal through a complex chemical process.
meanings.sent2: The alchemist claimed he could platinize any substance into a precious metal.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick appeared to platinize the coin into pure platinum.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to platinize his heart, turning it into something precious.
meanings.sent5: The potion had the power to platinize any object it touched, transforming it into platinum.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the metal will platinize and take on a silvery sheen.
meanings.sent2: The rock's surface started to platinize, resembling a precious metal.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar hoped to platinize and turn into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to platinize, becoming as smooth and precious as platinum.
meanings.sent5: The old building began to platinize, shining brightly in the sunlight.
